pros: pay still decent and colleagues are good

pros: Reasonable work life balance and compensation benefits for wellness and family, unlimited leave policy

pros: Compensation & benefits are comprehensive

review_title: Decent compensation but needs better career guidance

review_title: Company which does its best for its clients

review_title: Great place to learn but expect to work hard

pros: Good learning culture across globe and unlimited annual leave
cons: Changeability is a "two sided sword" Sometimes could be overwhelmed with too many things the same time Sometimes there is no project, then you take annual leave and learn new skills

review_title: Great place to learn, but make sure you have the fuel to drive on
pros: Accenture, being such a large company, has plenty of projects where you can learn almost everything related to technology. There's many roles in each project, and the management is very much into helping an employee grow.
cons: Make sure you have plenty of fuel, because you are going to be burning a lot of them.

review_title: Toxic culture with constant disrespect for boundaries
pros: Good line in your resume
cons: Learn nothing, you will mostly be doing grunt work. Toxic environment where everyone works against each other (they don’t actually root for you to succeed) and perpetuate bad culture. Management constantly makes you work unpaid overtime during the week (sometimes till wee hours of the morning) and spontaneously make us come in on weekends too, also unpaid labour. Any effort on your part to set boundaries or achieve some sort of work-life balance will be met with retaliation.

pros: Good culture Great company benefits
cons: Project basis, have to secure one fast

review_title: Great learning opportunities, diverse network, though extremely intense
pros: Large firm with many subject matter expertise around Tech, Data, AI etc. Great place to absorb information, implement the latest and greatest for clients and work with a variety of people in projects of varying scale and duration. Great for someone who has a thirst for knowledge, knows who's who and opportunities are aplenty
cons: Project scheduling is a hit or miss - you might get "stuck" in long term projects just for continuity or get allocated to a project outside of your specialty to fill in gaps (though great learning). More senior positions have to balance delivery versus last-minute business development work - taking work-life integration abit too far sometimes

pros: leave policy is good ( especially maternity leave )
cons: Some of the projects are poorly managed with unrealistic timelines. Had to work every weekend to cover up and meet the task deadline. Poor work-life balance. Management doesn't pay much attention to employees' opinions or to projects that have poor timeline management even if the resignation rate is high. After your resignation, you won't get a proper response from the HR or payroll team if you have any queries or clarifications. I had a bad experience of getting an inappropriate expense deduction from my final pay. Even after several emails with proper CCing of the responsible people in the mail, it was not settled.

review_title: Business and Integration Arch Senior Analyst
pros: - Learn a lot - Good Benefits - 'Unlimited leave'
cons: - Long working hours. (Frequently work till 9pm) - No annual pay increment (0% increment even after 2 years of working. Even though promoted once) - Frequently burn weekends (both Sat & Sun) to work - Having to attend to calls even at 2AM and get scolded by director if not taking up calls - No time to use leave. Can't even plan a vacation as will be rejected - Cry almost daily while working - Toxic environment - Ask to work past working hours but not allowed to clock in timesheet - No idea why am I still here...

review_title: Good start for fresh graduates who wants to get a glimpse of tech & consulting sectors but not those with family
pros: -Excellent insurance benefits. -Flexible work arrangements. -Unlimited leaves. -Agile working framework on most projects. -Many training materials (Mostly online self learning). -Many Diverse projects but up to your luck and project needs.
cons: -No aws, bonus is quite low. -Work life balance is not very good, need to work on weekends sometimes (Not so good for those who have family) -Lots of training materials but no time to read up due to project workload -High turnover rate

pros: a Excellent place to work
cons: not allow working from another countries

pros:
- Might be a good place for you if you want to try different things

- Good place to learn how to and how not to manage people and projects

- Close contact with clients

- Strong push for women when hiring, promoting

- Push for gender parity. Easier career mobility and when staffing for roles for women compared to men these days, for those without connections/networks
cons:
- Training approver may persistently not approve your trainings, even if relevant to the business and work you do

- Work is getting mundane these days. Do not be lured by the fancy things Accenture says you will do during recruitment. Highly likely those fancy things/roles are very few and wont be done by you.

- Dumped onto projects which are usually not what we want to do or build on your expertise. No proper training before projects.

- Managers and Senior Managers remaining these days only know how to talk or go around in circles, and dump work on juniors, who may not even report to them.

- Hard to travel at junior levels as most projects are staffed locally.

- Difficult to transfer to the business unit which is a better fit for your skills. Business units can be exclusive and not truly cooperative.

pros: GOOD to Work with Accenture
cons: Nothing can describe as CONS

pros: Training Equipping Management Culture HR
cons: Heavy work load Unpaid overtime

pros: Business model may work well in environments that are well diversify. Its a pro yes but definitely not in places where you have obvious dominated clients.
cons: Business model does not work well here. May work well in environments that are well diversify. However in this current environment where it is much controlled by the same group of clients.. Poorly managed and almost all being dominated. When they need you they squeeze you dry.. When they do not need you happily kick you off with ending in less than a month notice. Poorly managed. Poor career progression also as promotions and bonuses are so poorly done.

pros:
colleagues are great

above average pay 

clear career path for growth 

different firm level activities to join - I&D etc
cons:

projects can be rough depending on clients, timezone etc 

long working hours as you are expected to deliver

  Unlimited leave but that is dependent on your project and business needs. 

benefits are just ok

pros: well the pros are really the friendly colleague and very approachable tl's which there is namely 4 only.
cons: apologise if this is too strong to be an honest review ,too much cons for u to consider before you embark. I basically joined not long ago for a call centre project for a govmt body. And it is poorly led by a very kancheong and least professional project manager. Later then i decided that nope i dont see myself here, due to ; - no intensive training or buddy system provided. They will train some of us like 1 wk or less than 4 days and throw u on the ground to answer calls or make out bound calls. LOL to that. - the pressure is on like ur a kid in a sch n not treated like an working adult. - the director of the inchrg project will walk arnd with hands behind her back and walk arnd like a principle to show u her presence. like ur supposed to be very afraid of em. - they're too free to keep auditing n interupting ur calls and reprimand u infront of everyone like u hv no dignity. - theyre super lack of staff. thats y they rush u to be on the ground thats what we all newbies feel. - u will feel very judged and demoralize, all of my trainees feel like dragging their feet to work every single day. - they shudnt even get this person to be the project manager, her body languange is so such a turn off. the TLs are way better than her. Very humble, bet she also donnoe what shes doing. you can tell la shes plastic la chasing the ladder tryna proove her worth where she stand n how she can lead the team given that she just newly got promoted. very AUTHORATIVE. - after yr few subjects of training youre given a test. theres too many subject to absorb in a day, and they dont gve u that ample time to read, understand better or even breathe. - tell off the poor trainer infront of us like he didnt do a good job when hes very supportive and better than her. - tbh everyone is suffocating and complaining abt this new manager and how she handles stuff and even how she react to it. very unprofessional. - we all have feedback to our respective hrs but yet no action taken. - they like to use this " we cant afford any mistakes" when their mistake was to put u on ground for less than 4 days training or even 2wks training with too much products to remember -.-

pros: Great employer Time management Leadership is good
cons: No cons No cons No cons

pros: Good, get to learn lots of things
cons: Not much cons, compensation can be better

pros:
Working with smart minds and ability to explore a range of industries, project types, and internal roles. As it’s a huge organization, you may choose to move roles, teams, locations etc with internal transfers and reinvent your career.
Generally supportive environment (although this is highly dependent on the team/location you are in)
cons:
WLB is extremely challenging especially if you have family. Expect long hours and people who constantly talk about work. Ideal if you are truly passionate about your role/industry.
Get used to a certain way of working and expectations, difficult to introduce changes.
Compensation highly differs based on location etc. Always negotiate!!!!

pros: Learn a lot of things Good colleagues
cons: Bad Management Low performance bonus No AWS No work life balance

pros: good environment and has learning opportunities
cons: nope, just the pay can be higher

review_title: Very good environment to learn and grow
pros: Amazing expertise and teams, global presence
cons: Not so good promotion process for senior roles

review_title: A PLACE TO LEARN AND GROW
pros:
Indeed, Accenture provides a diverse working environment to its employees.
Immense opportunities to take whatever training you want.
As a matter of fact Accenture not just provide you apportunity to learn free courses but paid courses of upto $1000 for free.

Accenture values it's employees, the structure is designed in such a way that everyone gets their fair share of chance to prove themselves.

Accenture's work decipline is extremely friendly. Every person of Accenture is a specialist of something.

This is not an ordinary place if work but an extraordinary place for extraordinary tech driven people.
cons: Nothing as such, just don't judge an entire organization based on any individual's opinion.

pros: good team, people here are engaging
cons: long working hours, dependent on project

cons: More interested in listening to their client and not what Employees are facing plus ZERO progressions. TLs will dangle promotions but it is all part of the illusion.
